title_sort: walt whitman to william sloane kennedy and richard maurice bucke, 23 april 1888
title: Walt Whitman to William Sloane Kennedy and Richard Maurice Bucke, 23 April 1888

person.name: Richard Maurice Bucke and William Sloane Kennedy

recipient.name: Kennedy, William Sloane and Bucke, Richard Maurice

people: Richard Maurice Bucke and William Sloane Kennedy
text: CamdenApril 23 '88 I send Logan Smith's letter—please forward this & it to Dr. Bucke—I am feeling badly enough to-day—cold in the head & accompaniments—nothing very new—dull dark raw weather, inclined to rain—I am sitting in the big chair all the forenoon & day doing nothing—or reading the papers wh' is ab't the same thing—Mrs. L C Moulton is coming here this afternoon—I am reading Boswell's Johnson—My Elias Hicks plaster bust stands in the corner—it is good— Walt Whitman Walt Whitman to William Sloane Kennedy and Richard Maurice Bucke, 23 April 1888
